title: User Engagement in Research Findings on Early Career Learning at Work
abstractText:
This project aims to enhance the early career learning of graduate and other skilled workers and their managers through:

  • Disseminating its findings on the nature of the workplace learning of early career workers: what is learned and how, and contextual factors affecting the quantity and quality of that learning.
  • Engaging with organisations seeking advice on how to make appropriate changes in their current policies for supporting the learning of early career workers and their managers.
  • Engaging in joint activities with national level organisations and agencies, to whom the organisations targeted (under 2) may be affiliated.

The projectâ€™s Teaching and Learning Research Programme (TLRP) Research Briefing is used in conjunction with evidence from a previous ESRC project on mid-career learning, as starting points for engaging with organisations in five main areas: Education, Engineering, Health, Higher Education (both staff and students on placement) and Management. The aim is to explain how managers and senior colleagues can be prepared to become agents for the gradual enhancement of workplace learning through developing an appropriate learning culture. This involves giving priority attention to factors shown to influence learning, such as relationships, challenge, good feedback and the appropriate allocation and structuring of work.
